alert.note: Alert for Racine (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 27 at 11:35AM CST until March 01 at 12:00AM CST by NWS Milwaukee
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Wisconsin, including the following counties, Milwaukee, Ozaukee, Racine, Walworth, Washington and Waukesha. * WHEN...Until 100 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1135 AM CST, gauge reports indicated heavy rain and snowmelt. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of up to 0.25 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Milwaukee, Waukesha, West Allis, Wauwatosa, New Berlin, Brookfield, Greenfield, Menomonee Falls, Oak Creek, Muskego, Mequon, South Milwaukee, Cudahy, Whitefish Bay, Greendale, Pewaukee, Brown Deer, Sussex, St. Francis and Hartland. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
